snippet: The latest charge against William F. Boyland Jr. is that he steered taxpayer money to a nonprofit agency and misused it to pay for self-promotional swag.
abstract: William F Boyland Jr, Brooklyn legislator who has already been charged with soliciting more than $250,000 in bribes and filing false travel vouchers to the State Assembly worth tens of thousands of dollars, is now facing a new charge; is accused of steering taxpayer money to a nonprofit agency and misusing it to pay for self-promotional swag.
lead_paragraph: The latest charge against William F. Boyland Jr. is that he steered taxpayer money to a nonprofit agency and misused it to pay for self-promotional swag.

headline.seo: New Charge for Boyland Is a State Favorite: Stealing From a Nonprofit
headline.main: New Charge for Brooklyn Legislator Is a State Favorite: Pilfering From a Nonprofit Agency
headline.print_headline: New Charge for Brooklyn Legislator Is a State Favorite: Pilfering From a Nonprofit Agency
